description.en: Basics of probability theory are introduced. The most general distribution laws of random quantities, occurring in nature and exact sciences, are treated. The basics of statistical analysis of random quantities are introduced. An overview of measurement uncertainties and their handling with means of probabilistic approach is presented.
description.et: Tutvutakse tõenäosusteooria põhimõistetega, käsitletakse looduses ja täppisteaduses sagedamini esinevate juhuslike suuruste jaotusseadusi ning omandatakse juhuslike andmete statistilise analüüsi meetodeid. Antakse ülevaade mõõtemääramatustest ja nende põhjendamisest tõenäosusteooria vahenditega.

objectives.en: To give minimum knowledge in basics of observation and measurement data handling, including the data reduction and processing in practical work classes of physics.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda miinimumtase vaatlusandmete ja mõõtmistulemuste töötlemisel vajalikest teadmistest, sealhulgas füüsika praktikumis ja üliõpilastööde koostamisel vajalikest andmetöötluse põhialustest.

learning_outcomes.en: After the course, the students are expected:
1.	to know the essential rules of metrology;
2.	to be able to use most common distribution laws for measuring procedures;
learning_outcomes.et: 2.	oskab rakendada mõõteprotseduuride juures enamkasutatavaid jaotusseaduseid;

learning_outcomes.en: 3.	to be able to estimate the measurement and its expanded uncertainty at requested confidence level from the measured data;
learning_outcomes.et: 3.	oskab mõõtmisandmete põhjal hinnata mõõtmistulemust ning selle laiendmääramatust etteantud usaldusnivool;

learning_outcomes.en: 4.	to be able to analyze the measurement result and corresponding uncertainty reliability and to distinguish significant and insignificant components of the uncertainty;
learning_outcomes.et: 4.	oskab analüüsida mõõtetulemuse ning mõõtemääramatuse realistlikkust ning eristada olulisi ning ebaolulisi määramatuse komponente;

learning_outcomes.en: 5.	to be able to plan and to optimize the measurement methodology from requested error limits and the measuring instruments available.
learning_outcomes.et: 5.	oskab planeerida ning optimeerida mõõtemetoodikat, lähtudes etteantud veapiiridest ning kasutada olevast mõõteaparatuurist.

notes.et: It is possible to pass this course fully online.

resources.recommended_materials: Les Kirkup and Bob Frenkel, "An introduction to uncertainty in measurement".

description.et: Introduction. Terms used in measurement. Error and uncertainty.
Random and deterministic events. Distribution functions - distribution function, cumulative distribution function.
Moments: mean, variance. Median, standard deviation. Uniform distribution.
Exponential distribution. Gaussian distribution. Student t-distribution. Sum of distribution functions.
Central limit theorem. Generation of distribution functions from uniform distribution. Estimation of moments from experiment. A and B type of uncertainty.
Uniform distribution and B type of uncertainty. Practical calculations of indirect measurement uncertainty.
Training of solving exercises, preparing for test.
Test gives 20 % of total points
Residuals and degrees of freedom. The least-squares model and fitting. Estimation of intercept and slope. Uncertainty of standard uncertainty.
t-distribution and coverage interval. Welch-Satterthwaite formula. Evaluation of uncertainty  (without correlations). Measurement model.
Solving exercises using measurement model. Covariance and correlation. Correlated inputs.

Single measurement problem. The Welch-Satterthwaite formula. Insignificant uncertainty component. Example of planning and optimizing the measurement methodology from requested error limits and the measuring instruments available.
Proportional uncertainty. Autocorrelation. ESDM, autocorrelation and sqrt(n).
Presenting group works. Solving exercises using correlated inputs.
Presenting group works. Training of solving exercises, preparing for exam.
